description: [WHO] Vaccination remains an important public health countermeasure against COVID-19. As per the WHO Director General's standing recommendations for COVID-19, Member States are recommended to continue to offer COVID-19 vaccination based on the recommendations of the WHO Strategic Advisory Group of Experts on Immunization (SAGE).
title: Africa: Statement on the Antigen Composition of COVID-19 Vaccines

description: [Government of Mauritius] The High Commissioner of the Republic of South Africa to Mauritius, Dr Hlamalani Nelly Manzini, paid a courtesy call, this morning, to the Minister of Arts and Culture, Mr Mahendra Gondeea, at the seat of his Ministry in Port-Louis.
title: Africa: Mauritius and South Africa to Strengthen Cultural Ties in 2025

description: [The Conversation Africa] For many countries around the world, December is an intense, commercialised period of gift-giving. Not just within families but across all sorts of relationships, such as gifts between buyers and service providers.
title: Africa: Gift-Giving Was Practised By Early Humans in Africa - How It Spread and Evolved

description: [RFI] In his play Vielleicht, French-Ivorian director Cédric Djedje lays bare Germany's colonial past, through the story of the 40-year struggle of Afro-descendants to change the names of three streets dedicated to German colonialists in Berlin's African quarter.
title: Africa: French Director Cédric Djedje Shines Light On Germany's African Colonial History

description: [SciDev.Net] Lagos -- From fixing open gutters to educating kids about the importance of bed nets, a "whole-of-society" approach is needed to successfully shut down malaria, according to Michael Adekunle Charles, CEO of RBM Partnership to End Malaria -- a global grouping of over 500 organisations dedicated to fighting the disease.
title: Africa: Q&amp;A - Malaria Fight Needs Whole-of-Society Approach

description: [Africa Check] Ignore social media posts claiming these 'herbal pills' can shrink your fibroids
title: Africa: Ignore Social Media Posts Claiming These 'Herbal Pills' Can Shrink Your Fibroids

description: [Africa Renewal] From Fintech to AI, the region is leveraging technology to bridge gaps, foster inclusivity, and accelerate progress towards the SDGs
title: North Africa: Youth-Led Digital Innovations Reshaping North Africa's Development

description: [IPS] United Nations -- The World Meteorological Organization (WMO) warns that 2024 is on track to be the hottest year in recorded history, surpassing 2023. This can be attributed to heightened reliance on fossil fuels and the reluctance of industries worldwide to pivot to green energy practices. The rapid acceleration of global temperatures has alarmed scientists, with many expressing concern over the environmental, economic, and social implications of the worsening climate crisis.
title: Africa: 2024 Is the Hottest Year Ever Recorded

description: [GraÃ§a Machel Trust] The Kemet Boutros Ghali Foundation for Peace and Knowledge has honoured Mrs Graça Machel, Founder of the Trust, with its annual award in recognition of her contributions to the African continent.
title: Africa: Trailblazer Acknowledgement - Mrs. Machel's Lifetime of Work Was Honored By the Kemet Boutros-Ghali Foundation

description: [GraÃ§a Machel Trust] Did you know that over 70% of informal cross-border traders in West Africa are women, yet many lack access to the digital tools needed to grow and scale their businesses? To address this pressing challenge, the Graça Machel Trust, in collaboration with Network for Women's Rights in Ghana (NETRIGHT), New Faces New Voices Nigeria, and ComDev Senegal, recently hosted an ECOWAS Expert Leaders Group in Financial Inclusion convening in Accra, Ghana. Themed "Digital Transformation and Cross-Border Trade:
title: Africa: Graça Machel Trust Expert Leaders Call for Gender-Sensitive Policies in Digital Transformation and Cross-Border Trade

description: [Graça Machel Trust] We are dedicated to cultivating an exclusive, dynamic community where entrepreneurs can access essential resources, engage in meaningful collaborations, and continuously refine their skills. Within our private Facebook group, members gain daily support through motivational leadership insights, guidance on self-mastery, and live streams of vital events--all designed to advance holistic business growth.
title: Africa: Business Community Closed Facebook Group

description: [Graça Machel Trust] With more than 60% of women in the Women Creating Wealth (WCW) programme engaged in agriculture, this sector serves as a strategic focus for advancing women's economic opportunities. To overcome the critical challenges that women entrepreneurs face in accessing markets and finance, the programme is actively collecting data, documenting lessons learned, and developing targeted interventions to dismantle structural barriers.
title: Africa: Elevating Women Entrepreneurs in African Agriculture Sector

description: [Graça Machel Trust] One woman is making significant strides in Senegal's agri-food sector. Meet Aissatou Fall, the director of AF Goods and Services. Her company operates in the agri-food value chain, focusing on storage logistics and unprocessed commodities.
title: Africa: From Startup to Market Leader - How the Wcw-I Programme Transformed a Senegalese Entrepreneur's Journey

description: [Graça Machel Trust] When fundraising for women and gender led initiatives we find that the money needs to be chased, the money needs to be convinced, the money needs to be influenced and the money needs to be aligned to our values. We will do all these things but we will not lose our integrity.
title: Africa: Afrishela Reflections On 2024 - By Andia Chakava, Director of Investment

description: [Graça Machel Trust] Congratulations to Towera Neba on obtaining her MBA! After earning a degree in economics, her experience with women entrepreneurs motivated her to pursue an MBA in Marketing and Entrepreneurship, giving her the skills to understand better and address their business challenges. Now, as the Women Creating Wealth Country Coordinator in Malawi, Towera brings valuable insights, guidance, and technical expertise to enhance the program and support entrepreneurs in achieving their goals. title: Africa: Join Us in Applauding These Outstanding Individuals Who Elevate Gmt's Mission and Inspire Us All to Reach New Heights.

title: West Africa: Burkina Faso, Mali and Niger Reaffirms ECOWAS Withdrawal

description: [The Conversation Africa] Ever wondered why the colour of your snot is different when you're sick? You're probably not the first person to ask this question.
title: Africa: What the Colour of Your Snot Says About Your Immune Health

description: [IPS] Madrid -- Perhaps demographers would consider designing a new classification system to separate from their estimates of the world's total population -eight billion plus- the billion humans who live without legal identity and, thus, are deprived from the most basic rights.
title: Africa: These Billion Humans Simply Do Not Exist

description: [Africa CDC] Addis Ababa, Ethiopia -- 22 December 2024 - The Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (Africa CDC) congratulates the Egyptian Drug Authority (EDA) on its historic milestone of earning the WHO's Maturity Level 3 (ML3) designation for medicines regulation, marking Egypt as the first African nation to achieve this status for both medicines and vaccine regulation. This remarkable milestone highlights Egypt's leadership in advancing regulatory excellence and strengthening health security across the continent.
title: Africa: Africa CDC Applauds Egypt's Milestone Achievement in Medicines and Vaccine Regulation

description: [Daily Maverick] A clinical psychologist offers research-backed ways to work through grief and support grieving friends and family members during the holidays.
title: Africa: Supporting a Grieving Loved One On Holidays and Special Occasions - Practical Tips From a Clinical Psychologist

description: [CAF] The first leg of the final round of the TotalEnergies African Nations Championship (CHAN) 2024 qualifiers delivered an exciting mix of results on Sunday, setting the stage for dramatic second-leg clashes.
title: Africa: Sudan and Cote d'Ivoire Take Commanding First Leg Wins in Final Qualifiers
